entry.content:
As a volunteer coach for neighborhood robotics teams since 2010, I've had the honor of working with 62 talented kids through 130+ competition events spanning 28 robotics campaign seasons. We have been blessed with great kids that aspire for greatness and have won over 55 awards, with 10 at the national level. In my daytime endeavors, I'm a global sales manager for a technology solutions company, where I meet amazing engineers around the world who have a passion for making the best possible products. 

Learning takes place in three locations: our makerspace, robotics competition venues, and STEM outreaches to underrepresented and disadvantaged communities. 

A majority of our teams work in our makerspace programming robots, discussing teamwork, good stewardship, and core values of who/what we are. At robotic competition venues, students learn the merits of teamwork as they pair up to compete against other pairs of teams. Until COVID our teams typically complete about 10 outreaches per year to help promote robotics and STEM to underrepresented and disadvantaged communities.

I have a BSEE/MS-IT/MBA and worked at AT&T Bell Labs. In the last 16 years years have been in technical sales. I grew up and started working in our family restaurant at age 7 and continued helping for the next 22years. I saw how difficult life was for people without college degrees. Although not in full time philanthropy, I have always had a desire to help others.
